# Overview

**gwasplot** provides fast and efficient tools for visualizing and
annotating GWAS summary statistics. It offers functions to reformat
data, create plots, and annotate top hits with genomic features.

It is designed to work with output from GWAS performed on WGS data with
many rare variants, using [duckdb](https://duckdb.org/) to manipulate
data.

For more information, visit the [GitHub
repository](https://github.com/weinstockj/gwasplot) or the [project
website](https://weinstockj.github.io/gwasplot/).

# Installation

Install the development version of **gwasplot** from GitHub:

``` r
# Install remotes if not already installed
if (!requireNamespace("remotes", quietly = TRUE)) {
  install.packages("remotes")
}

# Install gwasplot from GitHub
remotes::install_github("weinstockj/gwasplot")
```

## Input formats

`gwasplot` expects output from either regenie or saige in csv or parquet
format (parquet is generally recommended).

Regenie output looks like this:

``` r
dplyr::glimpse(df)
Rows: 5
Columns: 12
$ CHROM     <chr> "chr3", "chr3", "chr3", "chr3", "chr3"
$ POS       <int> 90000011, 90000261, 90000274, 90000324, 90000366
$ ID        <chr> "chr3-90000011-T-C", "chr3-90000261-GATT-G", "chr3-900002…"
$ ALLELE0   <chr> "T", "GATT", "T", "C", "T"
$ ALLELE1   <chr> "C", "G", "A", "A", "G"
$ A1FREQ    <dbl> 1.37775e-04, 2.91090e-04, 2.38259e-04, 1.62637e-04, 4.66158e…
$ N         <int> 482670, 482669, 482669, 482669, 482669
$ BETA      <dbl> -0.00157451, -0.06463220, -0.06452010, 0.02796820, -0.021063…
```

gwastools will read in data from either regenie or saige and standarize
the column names, and then create a table called `summary_stats` in a
`duckdb` database.

# Key Features

## Data Quality Control and Filtering

**gwasplot** includes robust filtering capabilities to remove variants
from problematic genomic regions that can lead to spurious associations:

### Exclude Difficult Regions

The
[`exclude_difficult_regions()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/exclude_difficult_regions.md)
function removes variants from regions with known mapping difficulties:

``` r
# Remove variants from multiple types of difficult regions
gwas_filtered <- exclude_difficult_regions(gwas_stats, 
                                         beds_exclude = c("hg19diff", "UCSC_unusual", "GRC_exclusions"))
```

Available region types include: - **hg19diff**: Regions with assembly
differences between genome builds - **UCSC_unusual**: Unusual regions
identified by UCSC (gaps, heterochromatin, etc.) - **GRC_exclusions**:
Genome Reference Consortium exclusion regions -
**GIAB_difficult_regions**: Genome in a Bottle difficult-to-map regions

### Custom Variant Filtering

Filter variants using custom whitelists or blacklists:

``` r
# Keep only variants in a specific region or set
filtered_gwas <- filter_variants(gwas_stats, subset = "my_variants.parquet")

# Exclude specific variants
filtered_gwas <- filter_variants(gwas_stats, exclude = "bad_variants.parquet")
```

## Gene Annotation

Annotate variants with nearest protein-coding genes:

``` r
# Add gene annotations
annotated_gwas <- find_nearest_gene(gwas_stats, threshold = 1e5)  # 100kb window
```

Additional specialized annotations: - **CHIP genes**:
[`annotate_with_chip_genes()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_with_chip_genes.md) -
flags variants in clonal hematopoiesis genes - **Centromeres**:
[`annotate_with_centromere()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_with_centromere.md) -
identifies variants in centromeric regions  
- **Immunoglobulin loci**:
[`annotate_with_immunoglobulin()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_with_immunoglobulin.md) -
flags variants in Ig heavy/light chain regions

## Visualization

### Manhattan Plots

``` r
manhattan(gwas = gwas_stats, output_prefix = "my_manhattan")
```

### QQ Plots

``` r
qqplot_save(gwas = gwas_stats, output_prefix = "my_qqplot")
```

### LocusZoom Plots

Create detailed regional association plots with gene tracks:

``` r
# Plot a specific locus with gene structure
locuszoom(gwas_stats, locus_chr = "chr2", locus_start = 25000000, locus_end = 25500000)
```

### Volcano Plots

For post-GWAS analysis (e.g., after empirical Bayes shrinkage):

``` r
# Automatically uses lfsr if available, otherwise p-values
volcano(gwas_data, phenotype_label = "My Phenotype")
```

# Usage

Below are some sample usage examples:

## Basic Workflow

Reformat GWAS Summary Statistics Use the reformat_summary_statistics
function to read and reformat GWAS summary statistics from a parquet or
CSV file:

``` r
library(gwasplot)

# Reformat summary statistics from a file
gwas_stats <- reformat_summary_statistics("path/to/your/file.parquet")
print(gwas_stats)
```

## Complete Analysis Pipeline

``` r
# Load and reformat data
gwas_stats <- reformat_summary_statistics("path/to/gwas_results.parquet")

# Quality control: remove problematic regions for WGS GWAS
gwas_clean <- gwas_stats %>%
  exclude_difficult_regions(
    beds_exclude = c(
      "hg19diff", 
      "UCSC_unusual", 
      "GRC_exclusions"
      )
    )


manhattan(gwas_clean, output = "my_analysis.manhattan.pdf")
qqplot(gwas_clean, output = "my_analysis.qq.pdf")

# Get top hits and annotate with genes
top_hits <- gwas_clean %>%
  select_top_hits(threshold = 5e-8) %>%
  find_nearest_gene()

# Plot specific loci
locuszoom(gwas_clean, locus_chr = "chr2", locus_start = 25000000, locus_end = 25500000)
```

# Package index

## All functions

- [`annotate_variants_ensembl()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_variants_ensembl.md)
  : Annotate variants with functional consequences using Ensembl VEP API
- [`annotate_with_centromere()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_with_centromere.md)
  : Annotate data with centromere information
- [`annotate_with_chip_genes(`*`<GWASFormatter>`*`)`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_with_chip_genes.GWASFormatter.md)
  : Annotate top hits with CHIP gene information
- [`annotate_with_chip_genes()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_with_chip_genes.md)
  : Annotate data with CHIP gene information
- [`annotate_with_immunoglobulin()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/annotate_with_immunoglobulin.md)
  : Annotate data with immunoglobulin gene information
- [`append_ashr_results()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/append_ashr_results.md)
  : Append lfsr results from ashr to a data frame
- [`assign_gene_tracks()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/assign_gene_tracks.md)
  : Assign genes to tracks to avoid overlaps
- [`compute_sample()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/compute_sample.md)
  : Take a random sample of rows from the summary stats table
- [`db_connect()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/db_connect.md)
  : Connect to DuckDB
- [`exclude_difficult_regions()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/exclude_difficult_regions.md)
  : Exclude difficult regions
- [`filter_variants()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/filter_variants.md)
  : Filter variants
- [`find_nearest_gene()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/find_nearest_gene.md)
  : Find the nearest gene for variants
- [`get_biosample_for_accession()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/get_biosample_for_accession.md)
  : Get biosample to accession mapping for a specific accession
- [`get_encode_biosamples()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/get_encode_biosamples.md)
  : Get available ENCODE SCREEN biosamples for a given assembly
- [`locuszoom()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/locuszoom.md)
  : LocusZoom-style plot for GWAS results
- [`manhattan()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/manhattan.md)
  : Plot a Manhattan plot from a gwas object
- [`qqplot()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/qqplot.md)
  : QQ plot for p-values
- [`qqplot_save()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/qqplot_save.md)
  : Save a QQ plot of GWAS p-values
- [`query_encode_ccres()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/query_encode_ccres.md)
  : Query ENCODE SCREEN cCREs for a genomic region
- [`query_ot_api_v2g()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/query_ot_api_v2g.md)
  : Query Open Targets Platform API for Locus-to-Gene (L2G) predictions
- [`query_ot_api_variants()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/query_ot_api_variants.md)
  : Query Open Targets Platform API for variant information
- [`reformat_names()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/reformat_names.md)
  : Rename columns in the dataset to standard names
- [`reformat_summary_statistics()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/reformat_summary_statistics.md)
  : Reformat GWAS summary statistics from regenie or SAIGE
- [`search_cell_types()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/search_cell_types.md)
  : Search for available cell types and their biosample IDs
- [`select_top_hits()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/select_top_hits.md)
  : Pull top hits from a GWASFormatter or a data.frame/tibble
- [`volcano()`](https://weinstocklab.github.io/gwasplot/reference/volcano.md)
  : Volcano plot for GWAS results
